metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28390 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
ems_usb_start_xmit in drivers/net/can/usb/ems_usb.c in the Linux kernelthrough 5.17.1 has a double free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-224-generic - 4.4.0-224.257~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-224-generic - 4.4.0-224.257~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-224-lowlatency - 4.4.0-224.257~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-aws - 4.4.0-1104.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1142-azure - 4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-224.257~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.109').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1').
